Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Magnitudes of secondary pinprick hyperalgesia and brush - evoked allodynia were investigated using von Frey filaments ( gauges 10 , 15 , 60 and 100 g ) and brush strokes .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| (gauges 10, 15, 60 and 100 g) |

In this paragraph, the only chemical entities mentioned are the weights of the von Frey filaments, which are measured in grams (g). These specific weights are 10 g, 15 g, 60 g, and 100 g. Therefore, the table above lists these weights as the chemical entities found in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| (gauges 10, 15, 60 and 100 g) |

In this paragraph, the only chemical entities mentioned are the weights of the von Frey filaments, which are measured in grams (g). These specific weights are 10 g, 15 g, 60 g, and 100 g. However, the term "gauges" is not a chemical entity, but rather a unit of measurement for the thickness or diameter of the von Frey filaments. Therefore, the table above lists only the weights as the chemical entities found in the paragraph.
